Our Thanksgiving Holiday Timetable effective Thursday, November 23 through Sunday, November 26 is stuffed with service to get you over the river, through the woods, and to whomever's house you are going to. Off-peak fares are in effect for the entire four-day holiday period Thursday through Sunday, and you can take advantage of free parking at many of our stations. (Check for signs at stations, or call 511 for details. Outside of New York, call 877-690-5114.) On the Day after Thanksgiving, Friday, November 24, a Saturday schedule will be in effect with additional AM inbound and PM outbound trains. On Saturday and Sunday, November 25 and 26, we will provide regular weekend schedules with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. See our special Holiday Timetable: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm If you are traveling to/from Manhattan with family and friends to see the holiday sights, we recommend you use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten-trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device. See details at http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/thanksgiving2017.htm All of us at Metro-North wish you and your families a happy and safe Thanksgiving holiday!

West Hempstead Br.:W/B Train Operating 10 Mins.Late Due To Slippery Rail Conditions

The 8:28AM train from West Hempstead due Atlantic Terminal at 9:16AM is operating 10 minutes late due to slippery rail conditions - where train wheels slip while accelerating, or slide during braking - caused by oily residue left by crushed leaves on the rails. See attached link for info on how we combat slippery rail conditions.
Off Peak Fares in Effect thru Sunday

Now thru Sunday, Nov. 26, off-peak fares are in effect - including the Railroad's Family Fare discounted ticket. That means kids ages 5-11 (limit of 4 children) can ride one-way for $1 when accompanied by a fare paying parent or guardian. Weekly and monthly ticket holders pay just for the kids and, as always, children under 5 ride free.
Some Trains Operating at Reduced Speed Today due to Slippery Rail Conditions

Today, some West Hempstead Branch trains are operating at reduced speed due to slippery rail conditions - where train wheels slip while accelerating, or slide during braking. This is caused by oily residue left by crushed leaves on the rails. See https://goo.gl/KZUGjs for info on how we combat slippery rail conditions.

Cars will be added to select trains to accommodate holiday travelers. See attached link.

Our Thanksgiving Holiday Timetable effective Thursday, November 23 through Sunday, November 26 is stuffed with service to get you over the river, through the woods, and to whomever's house you are going to. On Wednesday, November 22, early getaway trains, which begin departing Grand Central Terminal at around 1 PM. Because of reduced ridership, some evening trains may be cancelled or combined. See an October 8 timetable for details. http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm Off-peak fares are in effect for the entire four-day holiday period Thursday through Sunday, and you can take advantage of free parking at many of our stations. (Check for signs at stations, or call 511 for details. Outside of New York, call 877-690-5114.) On Thanksgiving, Thursday, November 23, we will operate a modified weekend schedule with additional inbound trains for those of you heading to the Macy's Thanksgiving Holiday Parade. And we will have plenty of additional outbound service to get you home to the dinner table. If you're leaving New York after the parade, you must have your ticket before boarding your train at Grand Central or Harlem-125th Street Station. Use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten-trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device, to speed your trip. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo On the Day after Thanksgiving, Friday, November 24, a Saturday schedule will be in effect with additional AM inbound and PM outbound trains. On Saturday and Sunday, November 25 and 26, we will provide regular weekend schedules with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. See our special Holiday Timetable: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm If you are traveling to/from Manhattan with family and friends to see the holiday sights, we recommend you use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten-trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device. See details at http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/thanksgiving2017.htm All of us at Metro-North wish you and your families a happy and safe Thanksgiving holiday!

Whether you're heading "over the river or through the woods" this Thanksgiving, Metro-North's special Pascack Valley & Port Jervis Line holiday service will get you there! Early getaway trains will operate on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines on Wednesday, November 22. On Thanksgiving Day, Thursday, November 23, a regular holiday/weekend schedule will be in effect for both lines. For those heading in to the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, there will be a holiday extra train departing Port Jervis at 6:22 AM, arriving in Hoboken at 8:30 AM (a connection at Secaucus Junction arrives at Penn Station-NY at 8:39 AM) and to get home, there's a 12:21 PM departure from Hoboken (12:14 PM from Penn Station-NY) that operates express to Suffern, then makes all stops to Port Jervis. On Friday, November 24, a regular weekday schedule will be in effect, and on Saturday and Sunday, November 25 and 26, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect on both Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/wohthanksgiving2017.htm

Purchase Round-Trip LIRR Tickets and Metro/Cards in Advance

Save time and money when traveling during the Thanksgiving holiday weekend by purchasing round-trip LIRR tickets and MetroCards, or using the new MTA eTix app, before boarding your train. The LIRR wishes you a Happy Thanksgiving.

Our Thanksgiving Holiday Timetable effective Thursday, November 23 through Sunday, November 26 is stuffed with service to get you over the river, through the woods, and to whomever's house you are going to. On Wednesday, November 22, early getaway trains, which begin departing Grand Central Terminal at around 1 PM. Because of reduced ridership, some evening trains may be cancelled or combined. See an October 8 timetable for details. http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm Off-peak fares are in effect for the entire four-day holiday period Thursday through Sunday, and you can take advantage of free parking at many of our stations. (Check for signs at stations, or call 511 for details. Outside of New York, call 877-690-5114.) On Thanksgiving, Thursday, November 23, we will operate a modified weekend schedule with additional inbound trains for those of you heading to the Macy's Thanksgiving Holiday Parade. And we will have plenty of additional outbound service to get you home to the dinner table. If you're leaving New York after the parade, you must have your ticket before boarding your train at Grand Central or Harlem-125th Street Station. Use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten-trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device, to speed your trip. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo On the Day after Thanksgiving, Friday, November 24, a Saturday schedule will be in effect with additional AM inbound and PM outbound trains. On Saturday and Sunday, November 25 and 26, we will provide regular weekend schedules with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. See our special Holiday Timetable: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm If you are traveling to/from Manhattan with family and friends to see the holiday sights, we recommend you use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten-trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device. See details at http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/thanksgiving2017.htm All of us at Metro-North wish you and your families a happy and safe Thanksgiving holiday!

Whether you're heading "over the river or through the woods" this Thanksgiving, Metro-North's special Pascack Valley & Port Jervis Line holiday service will get you there! Early getaway trains will operate on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines on Wednesday, November 22. On Thanksgiving Day, Thursday, November 23, a regular holiday/weekend schedule will be in effect for both lines. For those heading in to the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, there will be a holiday extra train departing Port Jervis at 6:22 AM, arriving in Hoboken at 8:30 AM (a connection at Secaucus Junction arrives at Penn Station-NY at 8:39 AM) and to get home, there's a 12:21 PM departure from Hoboken (12:14 PM from Penn Station-NY) that operates express to Suffern, then makes all stops to Port Jervis. On Friday, November 24, a regular weekday schedule will be in effect, and on Saturday and Sunday, November 25 and 26, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect on both Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/wohthanksgiving2017.htm

Our Thanksgiving Holiday Timetable effective Thursday, November 23 through Sunday, November 26 is stuffed with service to get you over the river, through the woods, and to whomever's house you are going to. On Wednesday, November 22, early getaway trains, which begin departing Grand Central Terminal at around 1 PM. Because of reduced ridership, some evening trains may be cancelled or combined. See an October 8 timetable for details. http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm On Thanksgiving, Thursday, November 23, we will operate a modified weekend schedule with additional inbound trains for those of you heading to the Macy's Thanksgiving Holiday Parade. And we will have plenty of additional outbound service to get you home to the dinner table. If you're leaving New York after the parade, you must have your ticket before boarding your train at Grand Central or Harlem-125th Street Station. Use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten-trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device, to speed your trip. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo On the Day after Thanksgiving, Friday, November 24, a Saturday schedule will be in effect with additional AM inbound and PM outbound trains. On Saturday and Sunday, November 25 and 26, we will provide regular weekend schedules with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. See our special Holiday Timetable: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm If you are traveling to/from Manhattan with family and friends to see the holiday sights, we recommend you use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten-trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device. See details at http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/thanksgiving2017.htm All of us at Metro-North wish you and your families a happy and safe Thanksgiving holiday!

Our Thanksgiving Holiday Timetable effective Thursday, November 23 through Sunday, November 26 is stuffed with service to get you over the river, through the woods, and to whomever's house you are going to. On Wednesday, November 22, early getaway trains, which begin departing Grand Central Terminal at around 1 PM. Because of reduced ridership, some evening trains may be cancelled or combined. See an October 8 timetable for details. http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm On Thanksgiving, Thursday, November 23, we will operate a modified weekend schedule with additional inbound trains for those of you heading to the Macy's Thanksgiving Holiday Parade. And we will have plenty of additional outbound service to get you home to the dinner table. If you're leaving New York after the parade, you must have your ticket before boarding your train at Grand Central or Harlem-125th Street Station. Use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten-trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device, to speed your trip. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo On the Day after Thanksgiving, Friday, November 24, a Saturday schedule will be in effect with additional AM inbound and PM outbound trains. On Saturday and Sunday, November 25 and 26, we will provide regular weekend schedules with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. See our special Holiday Timetable: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm If you are traveling to/from Manhattan with family and friends to see the holiday sights, we recommend you use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten-trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device. See details at http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/thanksgiving2017.htm All of us at Metro-North wish you and your families a happy and safe Thanksgiving holiday!

Whether you're heading "over the river or through the woods" this Thanksgiving, Metro-North's special Pascack Valley & Port Jervis Line holiday service will get you there! Early getaway trains will operate on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines on Wednesday, November 22. On Thanksgiving Day, Thursday, November 23, a regular holiday/weekend schedule will be in effect for both lines. For those heading in to the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, there will be a holiday extra train departing Port Jervis at 6:22 AM, arriving in Hoboken at 8:30 AM (a connection at Secaucus Junction arrives at Penn Station-NY at 8:39 AM) and to get home, there's a 12:21 PM departure from Hoboken (12:14 PM from Penn Station-NY) that operates express to Suffern, then makes all stops to Port Jervis. On Friday, November 24, a regular weekday schedule will be in effect, and on Saturday and Sunday, November 25 and 26, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect on both Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/wohthanksgiving2017.htm

Our Thanksgiving Holiday Timetable effective Thursday, November 23 through Sunday, November 26 is stuffed with service to get you over the river, through the woods, and to whomever's house you are going to. On Wednesday, November 22, early getaway trains, which begin departing Grand Central Terminal at around 1 PM. Because of reduced ridership, some evening trains may be cancelled or combined. See an October 8 timetable for details. http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm On Thanksgiving, Thursday, November 23, we will operate a modified weekend schedule with additional inbound trains for those of you heading to the Macy's Thanksgiving Holiday Parade. And we will have plenty of additional outbound service to get you home to the dinner table. If you're leaving New York after the parade, you must have your ticket before boarding your train at Grand Central or Harlem-125th Street Station. Use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten-trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device, to speed your trip. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo On the Day after Thanksgiving, Friday, November 24, a Saturday schedule will be in effect with additional AM inbound and PM outbound trains. On Saturday and Sunday, November 25 and 26, we will provide regular weekend schedules with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. See our special Holiday Timetable: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm If you are traveling to/from Manhattan with family and friends to see the holiday sights, we recommend you use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten-trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device. See details at http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/thanksgiving2017.htm All of us at Metro-North wish you and your families a happy and safe Thanksgiving holiday!

October 31 through November 22 from 12:01 AM through 5:00 AM there will be full overnight closures of sections of the Northbound (North of Exit 18) and Southbound (Exit 19) Harlem River Drive for roadway repairs. The northbound access ramp from the FDR Drive to the RFK Bridge will remain open to traffic. Access ramp from southbound Harlem River Drive to RFK will be inaccessible. All traffic must exit at E. 132nd St/Park Ave and can follow the posted detour to the RFK and southbound FDR Drive at E. 125th Street. Motorists should plan accordingly and allow additional travel time during these closures.

Our Thanksgiving Holiday Timetable effective Thursday, November 23 through Sunday, November 26 is stuffed with service to get you over the river, through the woods, and to whomever's house you are going to. On Wednesday, November 22, early getaway trains, which begin departing Grand Central Terminal at around 1 PM. Because of reduced ridership, some evening trains may be cancelled or combined. See an October 8 timetable for details. http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm On Thanksgiving, Thursday, November 23, we will operate a modified weekend schedule with additional inbound trains for those of you heading to the Macy's Thanksgiving Holiday Parade. And we will have plenty of additional outbound service to get you home to the dinner table. If you're leaving New York after the parade, you must have your ticket before boarding your train at Grand Central or Harlem-125th Street Station. Use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten-trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device, to speed your trip. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo On the Day after Thanksgiving, Friday, November 24, a Saturday schedule will be in effect with additional AM inbound and PM outbound trains. On Saturday and Sunday, November 25 and 26, we will provide regular weekend schedules with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. See our special Holiday Timetable: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm If you are traveling to/from Manhattan with family and friends to see the holiday sights, we recommend you use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten-trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device. See details at http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/thanksgiving2017.htm All of us at Metro-North wish you and your families a happy and safe Thanksgiving holiday! Whether you're heading "over the river or through the woods" this Thanksgiving, Metro-North's special Pascack Valley & Port Jervis Line holiday service will get you there! Early getaway trains will operate on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines on Wednesday, November 22. On Thanksgiving Day, Thursday, November 23, a regular holiday/weekend schedule will be in effect for both lines. For those heading in to the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, there will be a holiday extra train departing Port Jervis at 6:22 AM, arriving in Hoboken at 8:30 AM (a connection at Secaucus Junction arrives at Penn Station-NY at 8:39 AM) and to get home, there's a 12:21 PM departure from Hoboken (12:14 PM from Penn Station-NY) that operates express to Suffern, then makes all stops to Port Jervis. On Friday, November 24, a regular weekday schedule will be in effect, and on Saturday and Sunday, November 25 and 26, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect on both Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/wohthanksgiving2017.htm

Whether you're heading "over the river or through the woods" this Thanksgiving, Metro-North's special Pascack Valley & Port Jervis Line holiday service will get you there! Early getaway trains will operate on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines on Wednesday, November 22. On Thanksgiving Day, Thursday, November 23, a regular holiday/weekend schedule will be in effect for both lines. For those heading in to the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, there will be a holiday extra train departing Port Jervis at 6:22 AM, arriving in Hoboken at 8:30 AM (a connection at Secaucus Junction arrives at Penn Station-NY at 8:39 AM) and to get home, there's a 12:21 PM departure from Hoboken (12:14 PM from Penn Station-NY) that operates express to Suffern, then makes all stops to Port Jervis. On Friday, November 24, a regular weekday schedule will be in effect, and on Saturday and Sunday, November 25 and 26, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect on both Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/wohthanksgiving2017.htm

Our Thanksgiving Holiday Timetable effective Thursday, November 23 through Sunday, November 26 is stuffed with service to get you over the river, through the woods, and to whomever's house you are going to. On Wednesday, November 22, early getaway trains, which begin departing Grand Central Terminal at around 1 PM. Because of reduced ridership, some evening trains may be cancelled or combined. See an October 8 timetable for details. http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm On Thanksgiving, Thursday, November 23, we will operate a modified weekend schedule with additional inbound trains for those of you heading to the Macy's Thanksgiving Holiday Parade. And we will have plenty of additional outbound service to get you home to the dinner table. If you're leaving New York after the parade, you must have your ticket before boarding your train at Grand Central or Harlem-125th Street Station. Use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten-trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device, to speed your trip. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo On the Day after Thanksgiving, Friday, November 24, a Saturday schedule will be in effect with additional AM inbound and PM outbound trains. On Saturday and Sunday, November 25 and 26, we will provide regular weekend schedules with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. See our special Holiday Timetable: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm If you are traveling to/from Manhattan with family and friends to see the holiday sights, we recommend you use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten-trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device. See details at http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/thanksgiving2017.htm All of us at Metro-North wish you and your families a happy and safe Thanksgiving holiday!

Whether you're heading "over the river or through the woods" this Thanksgiving, Metro-North's special Pascack Valley & Port Jervis Line holiday service will get you there! Early getaway trains will operate on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines on Wednesday, November 22. On Thanksgiving Day, Thursday, November 23, a regular holiday/weekend schedule will be in effect for both lines. For those heading in to the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, there will be a holiday extra train departing Port Jervis at 6:22 AM, arriving in Hoboken at 8:30 AM (a connection at Secaucus Junction arrives at Penn Station-NY at 8:39 AM) and to get home, there's a 12:21 PM departure from Hoboken (12:14 PM from Penn Station-NY) that operates express to Suffern, then makes all stops to Port Jervis. On Friday, November 24, a regular weekday schedule will be in effect, and on Saturday and Sunday, November 25 and 26, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect on both Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/wohthanksgiving2017.htm

Our Thanksgiving Holiday Timetable effective Thursday, November 23 through Sunday, November 26 is stuffed with service to get you over the river, through the woods, and to whomever's house you are going to. On Wednesday, November 22, early getaway trains, which begin departing Grand Central Terminal at around 1 PM. Because of reduced ridership, some evening trains may be cancelled or combined. See an October 8 timetable for details. http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm On Thanksgiving, Thursday, November 23, we will operate a modified weekend schedule with additional inbound trains for those of you heading to the Macy's Thanksgiving Holiday Parade. And we will have plenty of additional outbound service to get you home to the dinner table. If you're leaving New York after the parade, you must have your ticket before boarding your train at Grand Central or Harlem-125th Street Station. Use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten-trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device, to speed your trip. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo On the Day after Thanksgiving, Friday, November 24, a Saturday schedule will be in effect with additional AM inbound and PM outbound trains. On Saturday and Sunday, November 25 and 26, we will provide regular weekend schedules with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. See our special Holiday Timetable: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm If you are traveling to/from Manhattan with family and friends to see the holiday sights, we recommend you use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten-trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device. See details at http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/thanksgiving2017.htm All of us at Metro-North wish you and your families a happy and safe Thanksgiving holiday!

VERRAZANO NARROWS - BKLYN BOUND LOWER LEVEL

November 19 from 4:00 AM through 8:00 AM there will be a closure of the Brooklyn-bound lower-level of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge for an Emergency Preparedness Exercise. All traffic must use the upper level. The public may see an increase in emergency response personnel as part of the exercise. Motorists should plan accordingly and allow additional travel time during this closure.

October 31 through November 22 from 12:01 AM through 5:00 AM there will be full overnight closures of sections of the Northbound (North of Exit 18) and Southbound (Exit 19) Harlem River Drive for roadway repairs. The northbound access ramp from the FDR Drive to the RFK Bridge will remain open to traffic. Access ramp from southbound Harlem River Drive to RFK will be inaccessible. All traffic must exit at E. 132nd St/Park Ave and can follow the posted detour to the RFK and southbound FDR Drive at E. 125th Street. Motorists should plan accordingly and allow additional travel time during these closures.

An Explanation for This Morning's (Mon., Nov., 13) Delays

The 15-20 minute delays you experienced this morning were due to a problem with a Power Bond box located at the 125th Street station. Power Bond boxes are critical to ensuring the continuity of our signal system. Bond boxes keep the flow of propulsion current used to power trains from interfering with the current used for signal track circuits. A smoke condition from a power bond box on Track 4 at 125th Street required us to take one of four tracks out of service in this area to investigate, creating train congestion and delays. Crews were dispatched to the scene, and repairs were made shortly before 10 AM. Adding to the delays were slip-slide conditions due to fallen leaves throughout our territory. See http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/slipslide.htm for more details. We regret any inconvenience you may have experienced as a result of these problems.

Hudson Line busing between Irvington & Tarrytown for removal of Tappan Zee Bridge Span Late Fri. Nov. 10 - Early Sat. Nov. 11

Train service will not operate on the Hudson Line between Irvington and Tarrytown stations from approximately midnight on Friday, November 10, until 7 AM on Saturday, November 11 to accommodate the removal of a span of the retired Tappan Zee Bridge deck. During this time, customers should expect an additional 30 minutes in travel time. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/TappanZee.html See train/bus schedules at http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/TappanZeeDemo.pdf Customers should plan their travel accordingly by either traveling earlier in the evening or later in the morning when the bus operation is not in effect.

Hudson Line busing between Yonkers & Tarrytown for removal of Tappan Zee Bridge Span Late Fri. Nov. 10 - Early Sat. Nov. 11

Train service will not operate on the Hudson Line between Irvington and Tarrytown stations from approximately midnight on Friday, November 10, until 7 AM on Saturday, November 11 to accommodate the removal of a span of the retired Tappan Zee Bridge deck. During this time, buses will substitute for trains between Yonkers and Tarrytown Stations. Customers should expect an additional 30 minutes in travel time. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/TappanZee.html See train/bus schedules at http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/TappanZeeDemo.pdf Customers should plan their travel accordingly by either traveling earlier in the evening or later in the morning when the bus operation is not in effect.

OFF PROPERTY CONSTRUCTION TO AFFECT RFK - MANHATTAN SPAN - October 31 through November 22 from 12:01 AM through 5:00 AM there will be full overnight closures of sections of the Northbound (North of Exit 18) and Southbound (Exit 19) Harlem River Drive for roadway repairs. The northbound access ramp from the FDR Drive to the RFK Bridge will remain open to traffic. Access ramp from southbound Harlem River Drive to RFK will be inaccessible. All traffic must exit at E. 132nd St/Park Ave and can follow the posted detour to the RFK and southbound FDR Drive at E. 125th Street. Motorists should plan accordingly and allow additional travel time during these closures.

Hudson Line Busing Between Yonkers & Tarrytown For Removal of Tappan Zee Bridge 11/10-11/11

Train service will not operate on the Hudson Line between Irvington and Tarrytown stations from approximately midnight on Friday, November 10, until 7 AM on Saturday, November 11 to accommodate the removal of a span of the retired Tappan Zee Bridge deck. During this time, buses will substitute for trains between Yonkers and Tarrytown Stations. Customers should expect an additional 30 minutes in travel time. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/TappanZee.html See train/bus schedules at http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/TappanZeeDemo.pdf Customers should plan their travel accordingly by either traveling earlier in the evening or later in the morning when the bus operation is not in effect. View: http://n.v12.net/m?734CD

Hudson Line Busing Between Yonkers & Tarrytown For Removal of Tappan Zee Bridge 11/10-11/11

Train service will not operate on the Hudson Line between Irvington and Tarrytown stations from approximately midnight on Friday, November 10, until 7 AM on Saturday, November 11 to accommodate the removal of a span of the retired Tappan Zee Bridge deck. During this time, buses will substitute for trains between Yonkers and Tarrytown Stations. Customers should expect an additional 30 minutes in travel time. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/TappanZee.html See train/bus schedules at http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/TappanZeeDemo.pdf Customers should plan their travel accordingly by either traveling earlier in the evening or later in the morning when the bus operation is not in effect. View: http://n.v12.net/m?734CD

OFF PROPERTY CONSTRUCTION TO AFFECT RFK - MANHATTAN SPAN - October 31 through November 22 from 12:01 AM through 5:00 AM there will be full overnight closures of sections of the Northbound (North of Exit 18) and Southbound (Exit 19) Harlem River Drive for roadway repairs. The northbound access ramp from the FDR Drive to the RFK Bridge will remain open to traffic. Access ramp from southbound Harlem River Drive to RFK will be inaccessible. All traffic must exit at E. 132nd St/Park Ave and can follow the posted detour to the RFK and southbound FDR Drive at E. 125th Street. Motorists should plan accordingly and allow additional travel time during these closures.

All traffic must exit at E. 132nd St/Park Ave and can follow the posted detour to the RFK and southbound FDR Drive at E. 125th Street.
